isolating variables 
```{r reading in sample info and ordering factors, include = F}
read.csv(file = "C:/Users/gleno/OneDrive/Documents/16s Thesis 2/MD_2016_16s_margaretmiller.csv", 
         row.names = 1) %>% 
  mutate(Genotype_ourname = Genotype.designation..our.name., 
         Genotype_CRFname = Genotype.name..nursery.listed.as.) %>%
  dplyr::select(Year, Spp, Spp_colour, Genotype_ourname, Genotype_CRFname, 
                Sample_time, Sample_time_colour, Outcome, Outcome_colour) %>%
  mutate(Treatment_s = case_when(Sample_time == "baseline" ~ "control", 
                               Sample_time == "exposed" ~ "inoculated"), 
         Outcome_s = case_when(Outcome == "baseline" ~ "control", 
                            Outcome == "no transmission" ~ "visually unaffected", 
                            Outcome == "transmission" ~ "diseased")) %>% 
  mutate(Outcome_s = fct_relevel(.$Outcome_s, c("control", "visually unaffected", "diseased")))-> sample_info_tab

View(sample_info_tab)
```
